radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal biventricular systolic function with normal valves. No regional wall motion abnormalities.
Did not show any significant findings.
Large aneurysm in the proximal segment of the left anterior descending (LAD) artery. No evidence of plaque rupture or thrombus in aneurysm.

2.28 x 1.64 cm coronary aneurysm at the proximal segment of the LAD artery with peripheral calcification and a narrow neck of about 0.6 cm. Myocardial bridging noted in the mid-segment of LAD. Non-obstructive calcified plaques in the right coronary artery.
Did not show any significant abnormality.
